pullRequest.body:
Add `span_eq_closure` and `closure_induction` which say that `Submodule.span R s` is generated by `R • s` as an AddSubmonoid. I feel that the existing `span_induction` should be replaced by `closure_induction` as the latter is stronger, and allow us to remove the commutativity condition in `span_smul_of_span_eq_top` in Algebra/Tower and generalize `Module.Finite.trans` to allow a non-commutative base ring.

---

This is one of the uncontroversial parts of #9046.

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7430849124/job/20220982304)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7430849124/job/20220982388)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7430849124/job/20220982472)

This can't be generalized yet with what we include in this PR; this is an application of the `CompatibleSMul` class but there's some unresolved [controversy](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9046#discussion_r1429119479) with @eric-wieser.

(`restrictScalars` consumes `CompatibleSMul` which was derived from [LinearMap.IsScalarTower.compatibleSMul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/LinearMap.html#LinearMap.IsScalarTower.compatibleSMul), but in the absence of `IsScalarTower R S S` it can be directly supplied by
```
variable {R S : Type*} [Semiring S] [SMul R M] [Module S M] [SMul R M₂] [Module S M₂]
instance IsScalarTower.compatibleSMul' [SMul R S] [IsScalarTower R S M] :
    CompatibleSMul S M R S
```
in #9046.)

```suggestion
    [IsScalarTower R S S] [Algebra R T] [Algebra S T] [IsScalarTower R S T] (a : Set S) :
```

Indeed, thanks! I just wanted to refactor the two lemmas at the bottom using the main result `span_smul_of_span_eq_top`, and hastily proved this lemma by hand without looking further whether it already existed.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: generalize `Module.Finite.trans`
